Text: No. 25 Squadron RAAF:  The squadron was formed in early 1937 and until early 1939 was designated as "No. 23 Squadron".

<Text: No. 25 Squadron RAAF: During World War II, it provided local air defence for the Perth region, before undertaking Army co-operation duties in 1943–44 and then converting to the heavy bomber role in 1945.>

Text: No. 25 Squadron RAAF:  From 1948 the squadron's reservists flew jet fighters to provide air defence over Western Australia, but the squadron ceased flying duties in 1960 and switched to the ground support role.
